headline: Privacy Analyst - The Department of the Treasury
summary:
Combined eight years of supervisory experience, systems analysis and information management, policy creation, program management, audit and analysis with a reputation for meeting the most challenging organizational goals and objectives. 
A proven record for:
Leading staff at both a Bureau and Department level on program analysis and Privacy and Civil Liberties functions.
Embedding in Department level Privacy and information management programs to ensure compliance with Federal standards.
Providing guidance on executive orders, laws, regulations and oversight for privacy and information management to senior management.
Aligning management objectives and observing project progresses to determine compliance with policies, plans, regulations, and work planning. 
Resourceful and insightful analytical thinker, researcher, and problem solver responsible for analyzing intra/inter agency connections among various components of an agency to ensure laws, regulations and polices are in compliance as systems are developed, upgraded and maintained. 
Balance Complex interagency technology requirements and solutions against multiple stakeholder interest to provide solution that get the job done while protecting stakeholderâs interests.
Collateral duty as Contract Representative for my division, and contribute as a Budget Analyst to assist in monitor and analyzing the funding distribution by legislative actions.

positions.title: Privacy Analyst

positions.description:
Led the planning, design, scheduling, and implementation of data quality, data integrity initiatives for both long and short range projects
Supervised consultants on the development of a SharePoint system which would provide a robust, dynamic information management system as well as a record keeping mechanism.  
Provided authoritative guidance and technical oversight on compliance with privacy and information management laws, regulations, and directives. 
Identified and supports best practices, methodologies, tools, and platforms to maximize efficiency and effectiveness of privacy and security management.
Developed relationships with components, information technology (IT) staff and other bureaus, Federal agencies, and vendors to address privacy and security management needs.
Implemented corrective actions based on findings from reviews and/or studies.
Experienced drafting reports to support organization actions and responses to project findings.
Experienced leading the transformation of Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA), into the requirement for Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA), and Systems of Records Notice (SORN), when needed, and establishment of the maintenance and monitoring of administrative systems of required documents.
Collateral duty - COR duty for contracts in HQ management staffing, schedule review, and claims management for 2 separate contracts and 4 task orders.
positions.title: Privacy Analyst - Compliance

positions.description:
As team leader for government information specialist, I was responsible for high-level decision making on all aspects of the bureau FOIA management program as well as the development of policy and procedure for IT systems and record keeping processes. 

Accomplishments
Served as senior analyst responsible for Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) cases that required detailed tracking and reporting in the FOIA Express Database. As the functional expert for Database Administrators to ensure they implemented the conversion to a new platform correctly. Served as an alpha tester during the early phases of new feature deployments. 
Managed and implemented a FOIA management program that ensured compliance with the FOIA Act, National Archives and Record Administration (NARA) and regulations, agency directives, policies, and procedures at agency level.
Researched and investigated new and improved business and management practices for bureau programs and operations in FOIA and its records management. Through collaborative efforts, I was able to develop a process management program that consults, reviews, assesses, and audits records and cases that are open, pending, or complete. Researching and investigating new and improved business and management process for internal programs and operations to increase productivity.
Conducted business case analyses to identify mission requirements for internal processes while ensuring executive requirements are met. This led to the development of an internal process due to cost savings.
Developed and directed the bureauâs first hands on training program. This training helped educated new team members to applying FOIA exemptions to records throughout the bureau.
Developing new goals and objectives in the administrative and management operations of the department process management program. This includes the completion of a strategic plan for number of cases closed at bureau.
positions.title: Government Information Specialist

positions.description:
Processed FOIA and Privacy Act requests and provide advice and guidance to requesters, tasking offices, and the Office of Chief Counsel to ensure requests are perfected and recorded.
Provided recommendations to internal and external customers regarding the administrative aspects of FOIA guidelines, policies, and procedures.
Aided FOIA requestors to discuss the scope and clarity of requests.
Assisted in the development of standard operating procedures for the FOIA team.
Supported the FOIA coordinator for any appealed cases.
Provided policy guidance in response to FOIA requests.
Contributed subject matter expertise to reports that reflected data collection and distributed them to management, leadership, and other agencies.
Conducted briefings for senior level management on complex technical and non-technical matters.
positions.title: Government Information Specialist

positions.description:
Designed, developed and managed the content of data collections critical to the mission, and filed required incident reports to be shared intra and inter agency including Law Enforcement Officers and intelligence community, as needed
Communicated strategic objectives to multiple levels of management to facilitate comprehensive situational awareness.
Established working relationships with Customs and Border Protection, Immigration and Customs Enforcement, law enforcement officers, and intelligence communities.
Drafted, edited, and executed agency-wide enforcement notifications to individuals or designated groups by using various communications media as directed by management.
Evaluated security policies and conducted research and analysis to identify vulnerabilities.
Conducted risk assessments of travelers and monitored passengerâs behavior to ensure air safety.
Utilized incoming intelligence reports to identify known or potential terrorists, instruments of terror, criminals, smugglers, and other illegal patterns in a category âIâ airport.
Conducted enhanced screenings of identified individuals through casual conversations and referred to cases to law enforcement personnel as necessary.
Prepared incident reports to document all identified anomalous behaviors.
positions.title: Master - Behavior Detection Officer (BDO)
